description: Minimal Thompson primes: a(n) is the smallest prime expressible as p1*p2*...*pk-q1*q2*...*qj, where k+j=n and {p1,...,qj} are the first n primes.
references: J. G. Thompson, "A Method for Finding Primes", Amer. Math. Monthly, vol. 60, Mar. 1953, p. 175.
links: Jud McCranie, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..26
author: _Len Smiley_, Apr 24 2001
